meanings.definition: To make the same in quantity, size, or value
meanings.sent1: He equalises the amount of water in each glass.
meanings.sent2: The tailor equalises the lengths of the fabric before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully equalise the number of toys they have each.
meanings.sent4: The artist equalises the shades of paint to create a harmonious artwork.
meanings.sent5: The gardener equalises the sunlight each plant receives for optimal growth.
